articles.headline: Lobbyists Mass to Try to Shape Financial Reform
articles.snippet: A crucial committee moved to tighten rules on derivatives, the obscure and complex transactions that help lead to a financial collapse.
articles.abstract: A crucial committee moved to tighten rules on derivatives, the obscure and complex transactions that help lead to a financial collapse.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  Kicking off the latest chapter of this year’s Full Employment Act for K Street Lobbyists, representatives from a surfeit of industries descended on an influential Congressional committee on Wednesday as it began writing a law overhauling the nation’s regulatory system.

articles.headline: Cameras That Dazzle, and Dismay
articles.snippet: New cameras from Samsung and Nikon offer sparkling abilities, but the pictures need some oomph.
articles.abstract: New cameras from Samsung and Nikon offer sparkling abilities, but the pictures need some oomph.
articles.lead_paragraph: There are celebrations when a war ends, but sometimes confusion, too. The sense of purpose, the unifying morale lift, maybe even the economic boost, are over.

articles.headline: Industry Built From Scratch
articles.snippet: Though a long way from supplanting oil in motor fuels, start-ups have plants in place and are testing their production lines.
articles.abstract: Though a long way from supplanting oil in motor fuels, start-ups have plants in place and are testing their production lines.
articles.lead_paragraph: MADISON, Pa.  On one side of a factory here, workers dump 500-pound sacks of pine chips into a hopper. Deep inside the plant, an 8,000-degree blow torch roars like a jet engine as the chips are processed. At the far end, the workers turn a tap and out pours ethanol, ready for use as a motor fuel.

articles.headline: Curbing Emissions by Sealing Gas Leaks
articles.snippet: Leaks from natural gas pipes are big contributors to climate change. Yet many solutions pay for themselves.
articles.abstract: Leaks from natural gas pipes are big contributors to climate change. Yet many solutions pay for themselves.
articles.lead_paragraph: To the naked eye, there was nothing to be seen at a natural gas well in eastern Texas but beige pipes and tanks baking in the sun.
articles.byline: By Andrew C. Revkin and Clifford Krauss

articles.headline: Times Co. Will Hold On to Boston Globe
articles.snippet: After months of hunting for a buyer, The New York Times Company said that it had decided not to sell The Boston Globe.
articles.abstract: After months of hunting for a buyer, The New York Times Company said that it had decided not to sell The Boston Globe.
articles.lead_paragraph: After months of hunting for a buyer, The New York Times Company said on Wednesday that it had decided not to sell The Boston Globe, the newspaper it threatened last spring to close because of mounting losses.

articles.headline: Rivals Pose Threat to New York Stock Exchange
articles.snippet: Off-the-books private deals and upstart electronic markets are eclipsing the Big Board and New York itself.
articles.abstract: Off-the-books private deals and upstart electronic markets are eclipsing the Big Board and New York itself.
articles.lead_paragraph: For most of the 217 years since its founding under a buttonwood tree on Wall Street, the New York Stock Exchange was the high temple of American capitalism.

articles.headline: Connecticut to Scrutinize Food Labels
articles.snippet: The Connecticut attorney general said he was investigating a national labeling campaign that promotes products like Froot Loops and mayonnaise as nutritionally smart choices.
articles.abstract: The Connecticut attorney general said he was investigating a national labeling campaign that promotes products like Froot Loops and mayonnaise as nutritionally smart choices.
articles.lead_paragraph: Raising the stakes in the battle over nutritional claims for packaged foods, the Connecticut attorney general said on Wednesday that he was investigating a national labeling campaign that promotes products like Froot Loops and mayonnaise as nutritionally smart choices.

articles.headline: Wounded Soldiers Return to Iraq, Seeking Solace
articles.snippet: To get psychological closure, veterans are returning to scenes where they were maimed.
articles.abstract: To get psychological closure, veterans are returning to scenes where they were maimed.
articles.lead_paragraph: FORWARD OPERATING BASE NORMANDY, Iraq  Soldiers have often returned to old battlefields, to honor fallen comrades and to exorcise persistent demons. British soldiers go back to the Falklands. Normandy cemeteries are on many V.F.W. and American Legion itineraries. Vietnam veterans can even get package tours now to the places where they were stationed.

articles.headline: Calling on Big Banks to Repay Bailout Now
articles.snippet: Senior Treasury officials would like more of the nation’s biggest banks to repay billions of dollars in taxpayer money that bailed them out over the last year.
articles.abstract: Senior Treasury officials would like more of the nation’s biggest banks to repay billions of dollars in taxpayer money that bailed them out over the last year.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  Concluding that some of the nation’s biggest banks are in good enough shape to raise capital from private investors, senior Treasury officials would like more of them to repay billions of dollars in taxpayer money that bailed them out over the last year.

articles.headline: Pakistan Attacks Show Tighter Militant Links
articles.snippet: A wave of recent attacks shows that the Taliban, Al Qaeda and militant groups are tightening their alliance.
articles.abstract: A wave of recent attacks shows that the Taliban, Al Qaeda and militant groups are tightening their alliance.
articles.lead_paragraph: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  A wave of attacks against top security installations over the last several days demonstrated that the Taliban, Al Qaeda and militant groups once nurtured by the government are tightening an alliance aimed at bringing down the Pakistani state, government officials and analysts said.

articles.headline: Bill Shields Most Banks From Review
articles.snippet: The House vote, mostly along party lines, was a big step for President Obama’s proposed overhaul of rules covering the nation’s financial system.
articles.abstract: The House vote, mostly along party lines, was a big step for President Obama’s proposed overhaul of rules covering the nation’s financial system.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  Bowing to political pressure from community bankers, the House Financial Services Committee approved an exemption on Thursday for more than 98 percent of the nation’s banks from oversight by a new agency created to protect consumers from abusive or deceptive credit cards, mortgages and other loans.
